Now suppose you also have a B12 or Folate deficiency = the result of this causes something known as vitamin deficiency syndrome. The result is that your blood cells are too large. 

With neuroinflammation, large red blood cells, and stress = perfect conditions for dysautonomia.

Autonomy - being self governing (or in control of your life)
Relatedness - being able to connect with others
Competence - feeling competent at what you do

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: The best thing that ever happened to me as a child and I am nearly certain of this, is that my parents didn’t know what Autism was. I was just a quiet child. I have severe performance anxiety. If someone was judging me constantly I would regress. I still do.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: If people had seen what I had done when I was alone a lot of the time, I’d have been sent away to an institution as a child. I bash my head. I cut my arms. I still do it infrequently now. It’s an overloading response. It stops the flood of everything. I didn’t know why till 36.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: A2A Receptors seem to be important for the production of GABA which makes you slow down and be less anxious - It modulates the adrenal response to stress by acting as the gate-keeper of norepinephrine. Histamine blocks the production of GABA by A2A receptors processing adenosine.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: Histamine seems to be processed by the A2A receptors (known as the Alpha-2A adrenergic receptors) - so you can tell what their function is - they also are used for norepinephrine (the alertness functionality). Stress causes a lot of norepinephrine build up - fight or flight.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: Mirtazpine's sleep effect is by inhibiting the A2A receptors. Adenosine/Histamine H3 both bind to these receptors. They produce GABA. On Mirtazapine I had extremely vivid dreams - when you inhibit A2A, orexin production spikes.

The thing that makes REM sleep = orexin.

Autism = heightened senses + good awareness + sensory averse over sensory seeking
ADHD = heightened senses + low awareness + sensory seeking over sensory averse
AuDHD = the above.

Light touch here = generating arginine vasopressin (the fear hormone), causing aggression
Deep touch (bashing hands, strong pressure, or sucking fingers) = generating oxytocin for soothing

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

For me:
Running and flapping = generating GABA helps regulating
Screaming or humming = activating the vagus nerve for transportation, generating serotonin for happiness
Closing eyes and crying = stopping norepinephrine flooding and releasing all excess hormones

This one theory underpins so much success:

Body Doubling
Autonomy - I chose to do this because I want to work for an amount of time
Competence - The person next to me just likes I'm working and doesn't care about the result
Relatedness - I am not doing this alone.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

Which comes back to intrinsic motivation.
Autonomy - I am in control of how much time I spend on stuff
Competence - When I work on stuff consistently I feel better at it
Relatedness - As the work is higher quality, I am appreciated for it.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: "The journey is more important than the destination" is literally the main paradigm for my productivity. If I can make the journey important, I don't care about the destination, and consequently I get to the destination faster and with better results.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: I never go in with a goal of having the task completed just the expectation that I will work for x amount of minutes - this is why the Pomodoro method works for us - the tangible goal is just a realistic amount of time worked.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: Procrastination TEACHES us that we can do high quality work in short time. Society TEACHES us that the end result is the only important thing - the amount of time was important too. That is vital information. Short bursts frequently = best results for me.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: A tip I usually tell my clients is to stop focusing on the end result. Focus on a certain amount of time, and start small and build up, if you reach the limit and want to continue that's fine, record it though. If you are struggling to do it, just stop and come back later.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: The biggest limiting belief we have with procrastination is that we are taught it's a bad thing, and then because we don't get a perfect result (with usually bad parental reinforcement) this starts a cognitive pattern that we cant work in short bursts and be successful.

Acute Burnout = 
Dopamine deficiency (interest, motivation)

Oxytocin deficiency (love, social connection)
Cortisol excess (stress, sensory pain)

Compassion is a logical look at all the circumstances that may have caused some behaviour and deciding to act with care toward someone.

Compassion is a logical emotion, not a felt one.

* Gloves for tactile sensory 
* Masks for olfactory sensory issues
* Noise cancelling headphones for audio sensory issues

Ventilating the area with windows open also helps with dust.

If you have a child who has periods, periods are more extreme in ADHD/Autistic people as a trend. It also plays havoc with medication efficacy. This isn't well known. 

Be graceful and compassionate during the mood swings. 

A loss of control isn't the child's fault.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
Test anxiety is common. If your child has it, an exam focused school is the worst choice. If your kid has learning disabilities,  they will be vastly exacerbated during exams. 
Let your kid teach you what they learn, it will help with memorization.
Love your kid. It's worth it.❤

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
If your kid meltdown or gets super aggressive when loud stuff happens. Get some sort of noise dampening aid. They likely have hyperacusis and/or misophonia. 
You cannot reduce the effect through discipline, you can reduce awareness in the child. This will lead to unknown anxiety.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: Drama and music were pivotal in my development, as were pets. If you can afford these I recommend them, if your kid doesn't like doing something new, find out why, if they still hate it after a few lessons stop. Forcing it won't help.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet:
If your kid laughs or goes blank during times of stress. That is due to losing control. 

In these cases: Listen to their words, not their facial expressions. 

I didn't have control of mine till age 14.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

Your kid might have issues task switching, bake in reminders before the switch from something fun to chores. 

If you can don't complain about doing chores instead make it a fun family team effort. If you model something sucks, they will hate it.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

"I got an A on that assignment I worked on"

This is a subtle thing, but you celebrate the doing, not the receiving.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: Tell your kid you love them unconditionally. Yes unconditionally. Conditional love, means they believe they are conditionally worthwhile. Celebrate the stuff they are proud of, centre their feelings during this. Respect autonomy. Presume competence always.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: A lot of positive feedback loops (as in increasing not good) occur during the school years. You can circuit breaker these. Let the kid do what they want after school as much as possible. I wish my parents had tried to take an interest in the stuff I liked, rather than ignoring it

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: Don't make home punitive. Don't let the school enlist you in homework battles. That is between the child and the school, and homework should not exist. It does not increase learning, especially for ADHD or Autistic children. It does ruin home, and cause your child to run away.

1. Interoception - reconnecting and asking what my body is currently feeling.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: My Crohn's disease has dissipated now I have regained control of my life and understand who I am.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: This all comes back to being conditioned out of being who I was and being forced to be someone else The problem was this caused significant issues with interoception and I was generating internal body stress - Crohn's disease was a manifestation of external stress internally.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: * If a teacher thought I was a bad kid, I was a bad kid. If they thought I was a good student, I was their near best student. I pushed myself to study really hard for classes I was hated in, but I could study with ease for classes where I was liked.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: * When I was repeatedly told that I was naughty as a child I ended up studying everything I could about bad people to ensure that I did not become one and I developed moral OCD due to the belief that I was doomed to become evil.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: * When I was mocked for laughing with a wheeze, and also laughing inappropriately when I have an intrusive thought about something funny I learned to supress joy, till I could no longer internally generate it. I had anhedonia until just this year.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: * When I was told repeatedly by doctors that none of the issues I had were serious, I stopped responding to internal pain. I ended up in hospital despite horrific pain which I thought was mild after my bowel closed due to Crohn's disease because I hadn't digested food in 3 days.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: * When I was told that I was being ridiculous after breaking my arm when one of my dogs ran through my legs and told to have a cup of soup and a warm bath - I stopped feeling pain as much. I broke my collarbone and it reset without knowing due to no pain.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: I hated myself so much. My brain would just not work and then teachers and my parents would berate me for not trying. No one ever believed me, so I thought it had to be me. I was somehow doing this to piss people off. I was “broken”.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

This is why trauma informed care is vital. I had no idea I was traumatised, I thought it had to be war or something. I also met the clinical definition of PTSD. The emotional abuse received for me in my life time was far more damaging than physical and sexual abuse.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

You apologise a lot, even when there is no reason to. Someone hurts you and you brush it off.

We become the perfect targets for abuse. It’s the opposite of a victim complex, we make ourselves victims and believe we are not.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
It’s a total lack of personal boundaries. You always believe you are the problem. You don’t realise you’ve been doing too much. You feel guilty about being an awful person if you ever say no.

This is a conditioned trauma response. It can be unlearned but it’s hard.

There are no good and bad people. There are good and bad actions and behaviours.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet:
I also stopped judging them. That was the first thing I had to let go of - if I need unconditional positive regard to fix me... maybe they needed that too.

This takes some epic mastery to develop. I had to control PTSD reactions. It was a slow non-linear process.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: All it really took is figuring out how to communicate in the language they had been programmed into thinking about, figuring out what was driving the behaviour that hurt them, and helping them autonomously realise there is always a better way forward.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER

I know people will say this is pathological. 

The pathological thing is that we have this expectation, that some people are unsalvageable. It's been hard work - it's taken a lot of introspection, reading, mental fortitude developing, and care. They are more happy now than ever.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

"You aren't responsible for fixing your parents" - therapists.

Cool ? Who is going to do it then? Because cutting people out of my life is some carceral bullshit. I want to develop connection between people always. 

Healing these relationships restores my humanity too.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

YOU WERE A KID. NOTHING THAT WAS DONE TO YOU WAS ACCEPTABLE IF ABUSIVE.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet: You have to understand - I didn't seek help even when I was hurt here, because that was always the expectation - I should be hurt. When you are getting hurt by your parents it can't be they are wrong, it has to be that you are wrong. This means you justify and hide more pain.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
When you have authoritarian parenting which controls every part of your life, you don't know what a good and bad relationship is or what a healthy and unhealthy one is. 

Kids with autonomy, competence, and relatedness intact respect themselves to know this is wrong.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

Parenting 101.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
My behaviour is entirely explainable by the intrinsic human motivations of self-determination theory:
Autonomy - I was treated as an adult.
Competence - They told me how mature and intelligent I was, making me feel competent.
Relatedness - I was being offered social connection.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)
description: ADHD | Autistic | OCD Advocate | ICF ADHD/Autism Coach. Crohn's. Nonbinary. They/he. 🏳️‍🌈Bi/pan. Married https://t.co/VZgT3RHCER
tweet:
Lonely desperate kid looks for friends in an environment people are looking for something far more dubious but it’s guaranteed to mean social contact.

This is the most obvious outcome. Add in disrespect for authority due to maltreatment and I know why I did this now.

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

name: Rory - ADHD Autistic OCD (Away)

tweet: I was lucky I was ADHD and Autistic. My impulsive nature allowed me to find alternative forms of regulation. Sure I have PTSD from them, but the alternative would have been death. That I am sure of.

Do you know who tends to be really nice and help you gain access to both those things? People who offer you one for the other. 

I was a naive as hell child in many ways socially. This was really really toxic.

When they stopped me sucking my fingers, I became hypersexualised. That was an extremely bad outcome for a young child, and it was taken advantage by bad people. I also turned to substances. It was this, or plummet into despair and suicide.

tweet: The more destructive stims are usually responses to pain we are feeling but are unable to express in other ways. It’s a external manifestation of internal psychological or physical pain.
